macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Hit Record Highs After Mixed Jobs Report
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.65% to 6,966, Dow gained 0.48% to 49,504, and Nasdaq advanced 0.81% to 23,671 on Friday following weaker-than-expected non-farm payrolls, fueling rate cut speculation though probabilities declined for March. Small caps led weekly gains with Russell 2000 up 4.6%, while S&P 500 and Dow set historic highs.

items.title: S&P 500 Dips 0.43% to 6937 on January 12 Amid Cyclical Sector Weakness
items.summary: The US500 fell 0.43% on January 12 as industrials, materials, and financials weighed on the market, though Nasdaq edged up 0.16% led by Alphabet's 2.5% rally. JOLTS data showed sharp drop in job openings, ADP private hiring rebounded modestly, and ISM Services PMI surprised higher.

items.title: Credit Card Stocks Slump After Trump Threatens Profit-Hitting Moves
items.summary: Stocks of credit card companies dropped on January 12 following President Donald Trump's threats of actions that could reduce their profits.

items.title: Fed Rate Cut Odds Fall to 5% for January Meeting After Jobs Data
items.summary: Markets now price just 5% chance of a Fed rate cut this month and under 30% for March, down from over 40% last week, amid sticky inflation expectations ahead of key US data this week. US Dollar Index rose to 99.17 while 10-year Treasury yield held at 4.17%.

items.title: Oil Surges and Gold Tops $4500 on Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Brent crude jumped 2.18% to $63.34 and WTI rose 2.35% to $59.12 amid escalating unrest in Iran, while gold gained 0.77% to $4,510 on haven demand.

items.title: Weekly Market Recap: Small Caps Lead, Tech Lags in Broad Rally
items.summary: US equities notched robust weekly gains with S&P 500 up 1.6%, Nasdaq 100 +2.2%, and Russell 2000 surging 4.6%; strongest S&P sectors were consumer discretionary (+5.7%), materials (+4.7%), industrials (+2.5%). Dow nears 50,000 milestone.

items.title: China's Hang Seng Tests Breakout Amid Stabilisation Signs
items.summary: Hang Seng declined 0.4% last week after early surge but holds at range upper boundary with constructive technicals; China Life rallied 9% on policy support hopes as southbound flows resume.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Tests $92,000 but Slips Back Amid Sideways Trading
items.summary: Bitcoin briefly reached $92,000 during U.S. trading but fell back, trading around $92,381 after being near $90,300, down nearly 1% in the past 24 hours. It continues sideways between $84,000 and $94,500, needing to break $95,000 for a rally.

items.title: Analysts Predict Bitcoin Surge from Trump-Driven Dollar Debasement
items.summary: Analysts forecast Bitcoin's price to soar in 2026 due to further U.S. dollar devaluation under Trump, positioning it as the top macro asset despite being down 30% from its $126,000 all-time high and trading at around $90,716-$91,000.

items.title: Crypto Miners with AI Exposure Lead Gains as Bitcoin Underperforms
items.summary: Crypto miners like Hut 8, IREN, and Core Scientific rose 2%-4%, outperforming Bitcoin which declined nearly 1% amid rising traditional markets including Nasdaq up 1% and S&P 500 up 0.8%.

items.title: Ethereum Up 0.6% to $3,116; Major Cryptos Mixed with FXS Leading at +29%
items.summary: Ethereum gained 0.6% over the past 24 hours to $3,116 while Bitcoin dipped 0.2%; outperformers include FXS (+29%), REZ (+11%), and AMP (+10%) amid mixed trading for top cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Upcoming Crypto Senate Markups Previewed Amid Fed Investigations
items.summary: Bloomberg previews planned crypto-related Senate markups in Washington Policy Pulse, alongside analysis of unlikely Justice Department subpoenas on Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell and Trump's push for credit card interest caps.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA and Eli Lilly Launch $1B AI Co-Innovation Lab for Drug Discovery
items.summary: NVIDIA and Eli Lilly announced a first-of-its-kind AI co-innovation lab in the San Francisco Bay Area, investing up to $1 billion over five years to accelerate drug discovery using AI, robotics, and continuous learning systems connecting wet and dry labs.

items.title: Freenome Expands AI and Deep Learning with NVIDIA for Multi-Cancer Detection
items.summary: Freenome is collaborating with NVIDIA to advance personalized multi-cancer detection through fragment-level deep learning models handling massive cfDNA datasets, improving early cancer signal identification from blood draws.

items.title: BNL Develops Novel AI Method for 3D X-ray Tomography
items.summary: Brookhaven National Laboratory introduced an AI-powered method using enhanced U-nets with residual dense blocks and dilated convolutions to reconstruct nanoscale 3D X-ray images from limited data and viewing angles, trained on synthetic datasets.

items.title: Purdue Partners with Google Public Sector to Scale AI in Education
items.summary: Purdue University and Google Public Sector announced a partnership to integrate Google Cloud's AI tools across the institution, advancing AI-enabled education, research, and operations for students and faculty.

items.title: Claude AI Advances with Code Plugins, Blender Integration, and More
items.summary: Recent updates include Claude Code's 'ralph-research' plugin for self-improving AI experiments, seamless Blender 3D scene generation, and desktop features for local/cloud processing, highlighted in daily AI news.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon Launches This Week
items.summary: Nihon Falcom's latest JRPG entry in the long-running franchise is launching mid-week (January 15-16, 2026) with expanded narrative and refined combat systems. It's the most prominent release of the week for role-playing game enthusiasts.

items.title: Hytale Gets Second Chance After Development Cancellation
items.summary: Hypixel Studios' sandbox title with RPG dimensions is being revived and coming to PC this week, marking a rare recovery for a previously cancelled game.

items.title: BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW Explores Digital Obsession Themes
items.summary: A psychological horror game launching January 16 that examines online identity and social media anxiety through unsettling environments and narrative-driven gameplay.

items.title: Early 2026 Sees Light AAA Release Schedule, Boosting Indie Visibility
items.summary: The gaming industry is experiencing a notably slower start to 2026 with fewer blockbuster launches, creating opportunities for indie and mid-tier studios to gain attention and discovery.

items.title: The Elder Scrolls Online Announces Cross-Platform Play
items.summary: Zenimax Online Studios has officially announced cross-platform play between Xbox, PC, and PlayStation for The Elder Scrolls Online, though a release date has not yet been confirmed.

items.title: Original Quake Optimized for Steam Deck and Xbox Handheld
items.summary: The classic Quake game has been officially optimized for both Steam Deck and Xbox's portable console, expanding accessibility for retro FPS fans.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: CES 2026 Shifts Focus From Consumer Gadgets to AI Infrastructure and Robotics
items.summary: CES 2026 demonstrates a major industry shift away from consumer product reveals toward robotics, automation, and industrial infrastructure. The standout theme emphasizes practical deployment of robots and AI-enabled devices with real-world applications.

items.title: Motional Refocuses Robotaxi Strategy Around AI for 2026 Deployment
items.summary: Autonomous vehicle startup Motional is centering its robotaxi strategy on AI to achieve scalable, cost-effective driverless deployment while meeting safety and regulatory requirements.

items.title: Patmos Data Company Purchases Kansas City Star Building for AI Campus Expansion
items.summary: Patmos has purchased the former Kansas City Star building to expand its AI campus with co-working spaces, event venues, and tech hub facilities. The company is leveraging a loan program for AI infrastructure development.

items.title: Purdue University and Google Public Sector Announce Strategic Partnership
items.summary: Purdue University and Google Public Sector announced a strategic partnership on January 12 to scale AI integration and accelerate education and research initiatives across the institution.

items.title: Retail Industry Increases IT Infrastructure Investment Amid Digital Transformation
items.summary: Kyndryl's 2025 Retail Readiness Report shows 48% of retail leaders have upgraded IT infrastructure and increased investments by 33%, though technical debt remains a significant constraint for nearly a quarter of retailers.
